Uses of Class
cellularAutomata.rules.RuleActions

Packages that use RuleActions
cellularAutomata.rules

Uses of RuleActions in cellularAutomata.rules
 

Subclasses of RuleActions in cellularAutomata.rules
 class ALifePi
          Uses a genetic algorithm to solve for Pi.
 class AlternateContinuousCA
          Takes the average of the neighbors, plugs into the linear equation "slope * avg + yInterecept", and then keeps only the fractional part.
 class BriansBrain
          Brian's Brain rule (discovered/popularized by Brian Silverman).
 class Bunnies
          This surprising CA uses many states to create a bunny rabbit shape.
 class ChainLinkFence
          From a single initial sead, his rule will build a square lattice.
 class ChutesLaddersAndShifts
          A rule which produces chutes, ladders, ray guns, and a wide variety of other behaviors depending on the number of states.
 class CollidingCyclones
          Create a cyclic CA rule with spirals, inspired/discovered by David Griffeath.
 class ComplexContinuousCA
          Takes the average of the cell and its neighbors, plugs into the linear equation "slope * avg + yInterecept", and then keeps only the fractional part.
 class ComplexLife
          Creates a Life-like simulation.
 class ComplexSortTwoDim
          Sorts complex numbers in two-dimensional space.
 class ContinuousCA
          Takes the average of the cell and its neighbors, plugs into the linear equation "slope * avg + yInterecept", and then keeps only the fractional part.
 class CoolClassIV
          Creates a class IV CA with 3 states corresponding to totalistic rule number 1329.
 class CopyRandomNeighbor
          Copies the value of a random neighbor.
 class CrystalLife
          Outer totalistic rule 435 with a running average of 2.
 class CyclicCA
          Create a cyclic CA, inspired/discovered by David Griffeath.
 class CyclicPulse
          Cells always increase in value, but they increase by double the normal amount if surrounded by 4 or more neighbors with larger values.
 class Diffusion
          Rules for diffusion which obey the heat equation dp/dt = del^2 p.
 class DiffusionLimitedAggregation
          Rule for diffusion limited aggregation.
 class DrunkGliders
          A rule on a hexagonal lattice which produces stunning, drunk gliders.
 class ElectricLoops
          Outer totalistic rule 301 with a running average of 2.
 class EpilepticBlobs
          Outer totalistic rule 429.
 class Fireworks
          A fun rule that looks like fireworks when started from a single seed.
 class ForestFire
          Rule that mimics a forest fire.
 class Fractal
          A rule which assigns complex numbers to each cell and then displays them as Mandelbrot and Julia sets.
 class FractalIteration
          A rule which assigns complex numbers to each cell and then displays them as Mandelbrot and Julia sets.
 class FractalThreshold
          A rule which assigns complex numbers to each cell; if the modulus of "the sum of the neighbors minus the cell" is less than a threshold, then the cell is multiplied by 1-i.
 class GalacticFlashWeb
          Cells always increase in value, but they increase by double the normal amount if surrounded by 6 or more neighbors with larger values.
 class GrowingSeed
          If any neighbor is occupied, then the cell becomes occupied with state 1.
 class HexLife
          Same as the class Life, but with hexagonal graphics.
 class House
          This surprising CA uses many states to create a house shape.
 class IntegerAverage
          Averages the cell and it's neighbors and returns the nearest integer.
 class IntegerRule
          A base class for all integer-based rules (not vectors of integers, just single integers).
 class IntegerSort
          Sorts integer numbers on a one-dimensional line.
 class IsingModel
          The classic two-state Ising Model from physics.
 class Julia
          A rule which uses a complex number for each cell.
 class Lambda
          Randomly generates a rule with the given value of lambda (provided through an "additional properties panel").
 class LatticeGas
          Rules for a hexagonal lattice gas automaton following the basic FHP approach.
 class LavaLamp
          Create a cyclic CA, inspired/discovered by Jason Rampe.
 class Life
          Rules for the game of life.
 class Lightning
          Creates a class III CA with interweaving class IV? Looks like lightning! From rule number 6055785317397.
 class MajorityProbablyWins
          Rule for joining factions based on the percent present.
 class MajorityWins
          Rule for the majority winning.
 class MajorityWinsWithRealValues
          Cells take the closer value of two randomly selected neighbors.
 class MajorityWinsWithSelf
          Rule for the majority winning.
 class MajorityWinsWithSelfAndReals
          Cells becomes the median value of themselves and their neighbors.
 class MinorityWins
          Rule for the minority winning.
 class MinorityWinsWithSelf
          Rule for the minority winning.
 class MovingFractal
          A lattice-gas-style rule with vectors of complex numbers.
 class NeuralNet
          A rule that treats each cell as a neuron.
 class Nucleation
          Create a cyclic CA, inspired/discovered by Jason Rampe.
 class ObesityModel
          Rule for becoming obese based on your neighbors obesity.
 class OuterTotalistic
          Creates an outer totalistic CA rule for a given lattice and rule "code".
 class PistonPrime
          Similar to Life but not as dynamic and ending in still life with occasional pistons.
 class PrettyClassIV
          Creates a class IV CA with 4 states corresponding to rule number 27645726470709879688601734854573817858 (as outlined by the numbering scheme in the RuleNumber class).
 class PrimeDeath
          Similar to Life, but most patterns create gliders.
 class PrimePlague
          Similar to Life but not as dynamic and ending in still life with occasional pistons.
 class PulsingSnowflake
          Similar to the Q2R Ising rule, but with three states.
 class Q2RIsingModel
          A deterministic version of the Ising Model from physics.
 class RandomUpdate
          Randomly chooses a new state for the cell, independent of the neighbors.
 class RealSort
          Sorts real numbers on a one-dimensional line.
 class RealSpirals
          Cells always increase in value, but they increase by double the normal amount if surrounded by 2 or more neighbors with larger values.
 class ReversibleRuleNumber
          Same as WolframRuleNumber but XORs the answer with the cell's state from the previous generation as well.
 class RockPaperScissorsRule
          Rule that plays the game rock-paper-scissors.
 class Rule
          A function that changes a cell's state based on the states of neighboring cells.
 class Rule110
          The two-state CA rule 110, numbered according to Wolfram's numbering scheme.
 class Rule30
          The two-state CA rule 30, numbered according to Wolfram's numbering scheme.
 class RuleNumber
          Creates an integer-based rule from a rule number specified by the user.
 class SatansStaircase
          Creates a three-dimensional staircase out of triangles.
 class SelfishCA
          The neighbors are used to determine what rule is applied to each cell.
 class Snowflake
          Outer totalistic rule 846.
 class SnowflakeDust
          Outer totalistic rule 68.
 class SnowflakeMaze
          Outer totalistic rule 750.
 class Spirals
          On a square (8 neighbor) lattice, this rule produces spirals that never stop unwinding.
 class SumModuloN
          A rule which calculates the sum modulo N of the neighbors.
 class SuperLoops
          Outer totalistic rule 429 with a running average of 2.
 class Symmetry
          A sample rule illustrating symmetries.
 class ThunderStorm
          Takes the average of the cell and neighbors, adds a small periodic amount, and modulos by the maximum value.
 class Totalistic
          Creates a totalistic CA rule for a given lattice and rule "code".
 class TriLife
          Same as the class Life, but with triangular graphics.
 class TunnellingSpaceships
          A rule which produces spaceship-like lines, and a wide variety of other behaviors depending on the number of states and the lattice.
 class WaterSkimmers
          Takes the average of the cell and neighbors, adds a small random amount, and modulos by the maximum value.
 class WolframRuleNumber
          Binary rules apply to linear one-dimensional CA.
 

Uses of RuleActions in cellularAutomata.rules.templates
 

Subclasses of RuleActions in cellularAutomata.rules.templates
 class BinaryRuleTemplate
          A template/convenience class for all rules that behave as boolean function of their neighbors.
 class ComplexMargolusTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that use the Margolus neighborhood with complex number states.
 class ComplexRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for any rules that need cell states based on a complex number.
 class ComplexVectorRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for any rules that need cell states based on an array of complex values.
 class CyclicCATemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that behave as so-called Cyclic CA.
 class FiniteDifferenceTemplate
          A convenience class/template for any rules that need cell states based on a double value.
 class FiniteObjectRuleTemplate
           A convenience class/template for all rules that have a finite number of states of any type (for example, Complex numbers, Doubles, Colors, Images, Files, or even a mix of different types).
 class IntegerMargolusTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that use the Margolus neighborhood with integer states.
 class IntegerRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that behave as an integer function of their neighbors.
 class IntegerRuleWithCellsTemplate
          Almost identical to the IntegerRuleTemplate class (see that description).
 class IntegerVectorRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for any rules that need cell states based on an integer array of values.
 class LifeExtensionsTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that behave similar to the Life rule with births occurring when a certain number of neighbors are occupied, and survivals occurring when a certain number of neighbors are occupied.
 class MultiGenerationBinaryRuleTemplate
          A template/convenience class for all rules that behave as boolean function of their neighbors at the current and some previous number of time steps.
 class MultiGenerationIntegerRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that behave as an integer function of their neighbors, both at the current time step and for an arbitrary number of previous time steps.
 class ObjectRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for any rules that need cell states based on an Object.
 class OneDimensionalIntegerMargolusTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that use the one-dimensional Margolus neighborhood with integer states.
 class OneDimensionalRealMargolusTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that use the one-dimensional Margolus neighborhood with real-valued states.
 class RealMargolusTemplate
          A convenience class/template for all rules that use the Margolus neighborhood with real-valued states.
 class RealRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for any rules that need cell states based on a double value.
 class RealVectorRuleTemplate
          A convenience class/template for any rules that need cell states based on a double array of values.
 

Uses of RuleActions in userRules
 

Subclasses of RuleActions in userRules
 class ExampleColorAverage
          For each of the three color components (red, green, and blue), this rule finds the average red, the average blue, and the average green of a cell and its neighbors.
 class ExampleRealAverage
          Finds the average of a cell and all of its neighbors.
 class ExampleVectorAverage
          Finds the average of a cell and all of its neighbors.
 class MinimumRule
          A CA rule that updates a cell's state to be the minimum of its neighbors and itself.
 class ObjectExample
          Finds the average of a cell and all of its neighbors.
 class Rule102
          A rule which calculates the sum modulo N of a cell and one of its neighbors (the last neighbor in its list of neighbors).
 class SearsTower
          A rule which calculates (cell + (generation * (sum of neighbors)) % 3) % N.
 class ThreeXPlusOne
          A rule which uses the 3x+1 problem to calculate the next state of a cell.
 class YoungVsOld
          Young versus Old is a rule that will generate a cells value based both on the value of its neighbors and the number of neighbors.
